context/0: Arm's almost healed, sir, really it is.
context/1: Excuse me, sir, I'd like to go along too.
context/2: The kind of guts that can get us all killed.
context/3: You don't see what I mean at all.
context/4: I see what you mean.
context/5: Also the kind they had in 1914 when officers fought with only a swagger stick.
context/6: That kind of guts.
context/7: How's that, sir?
context/8: "Into the valley of death rode the 600."
context/9: He's got guts.

context: You've got to do it now!
context/0: You've got to do it, boy!
context/4: He's leading him right to it!
context/6: I think we better have a look around before that train comes across.
context/7: Colonel, there's something rather odd going on.
context/9: River's gone down in the night.

context: You're telling me not to be taken alive.
context/1: Much better than the old ones.
context/4: L pill?
context/6: By the way, here's something that'll interest you.
context/7: It's almost as if your whole escape had been planned with us in mind.
context/8: Your knowledge of the area, making friends in that village.
context/9: You don't realise what a plum you are for us.

context: Yes, indeed.
context/0: I think you know most of these ladies.
context/1: Oh, that's quite all right, Mr. Staley.
context/2: I'd better come back some other time.
context/3: I didn't know you had company, Mrs. Brenner.
context/4: You'd be surprised at some of the tricks they've tried.
context/5: And this time if you don't mind, I'll take a little look around.
context/6: Thanks.
context/7: Come in.
context/8: Or else I might have to raise the price on you.
context/9: And no more tricks.

context: What will it be?
context/0: You deserve a reward and I am willing to give you one.
context/1: And fortunately we did it, boss.
context/2: I immediately knew you were trying to rescue me.
context/3: It was a good idea that you sent that paper... with the image of a bat.
context/4: It was a good idea that you sent that paper...
context/6: I need his help to organize my papers.
context/7: Not yet, Eduardo.
context/9: In two or three days.

context: They were returning to Sand Creek, said they'd been on a trading mission.
context/0: You mean you saw no rifles but they were illegally off the reservation.
context/1: Not a rifle in the whole outfit.
context/4: How do you know?
context/5: But not the renegades we're looking for.
context/6: Yes?
context/7: Sir, we ran across a band of Cheyenne off the reservation.
context/9: Thank you, Captain.

context: # We've been working all day long
context/3: If Indians don't attack at night, why can't we bring water in there?
context/4: Start on that one over there.
context/5: # Pass the bucket down the line...
context/6: # Pass the bucket down the line
context/7: # Passing the water, darling
context/8: # We've been working all day long
context/9: # We've been working all day long

context: Well, open the door.
context/4: Yes.
context/6: Hurry, Indians!
context/7: Get the Lieutenant.
context/9: Indians!

context: 20 years ago, the concept of an alien race was novel to us, hence.
context/0: All this took place in 1938 in a less sophisticated yesteryear that did not know the atom bomb guided missiles and rockets that may shortly fly to the moon.
context/1: But there is one thing we must not overlook.
context/2: So the reactions of the period.
context/4: Buffalo, New York, that's where I'm calling from.
context/6: I'm 300 miles from home without a penny in my pocket.
context/7: Say, what are you gonna do about me?
context/9: And still others we're furiously angry.

context: And what am I supposed to be, a human lie detector or something?
response: He did send you the money for the cabin?
context/0: Of course, how many gives their real names?
context/2: He give me the name of Stokes.
context/3: So this man calls from L.A. last night.
context/4: The district attorney included.
context/6: Some people might think I was overzealous.
context/7: Taking charge of an estate before there was an estate.
context/9: If he is, I've committed a crime or two.

context: Nearly closing time, Ben.
response: You were a bit late last night, we can't have that, you know.
context/1: I ain't sold none all day.
context/2: Buy a flower for your young lady, Sir,
context/4: You're twisting my words.
context/5: I didn't say that at all.
context/6: Now, wait a minute, I didn't say that.
context/7: So you have made no progress then?
context/8: You can't expect us to nab the man instantly when he left no clues at all.
context/9: Now, see here, this only happened the night before last.
